metadata.title: CVE-2022-23960 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Certain Arm Cortex and Neoverse processors through 2022-03-08 do notproperly restrict cache speculation, aka Spectre-BHB. An attacker canleverage the shared branch history in the Branch History Buffer (BHB) toinfluence mispredicted branches. Then, cache allocation can allow theattacker to obtain sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1').
